org.trianacode.taskgraph.service

Class RunnableTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.trianacode.taskgraph.imp.ToolImp
      • org.trianacode.taskgraph.imp.TaskImp
        • org.trianacode.taskgraph.service.AbstractRunnableTask
          • org.trianacode.taskgraph.service.RunnableTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, ClipableTaskInterface, ControlInterface, RunnableInstance, RunnableInterface, Task, Tool

    public class RunnableTask
extends AbstractRunnableTask
implements RunnableInstance, RunnableInterface, ControlInterface, java.lang.Runnable
    An extension to Task that allows the underlying OldUnit to be instantiated and run.

      • finished

        public final void finished()
        Tells the Unit that an output node has finished sending the data. Here, we simply decrement the packetsLeft variabe which is set to be equal to the number of non-blocking nodes wich are sending the data.
        Specified by:
        finished in interface RunnableInstance
        Specified by:
        finished in class AbstractRunnableTask

      • getInput

        public java.lang.Object getInput(int nodeNumber)
                          throws OutOfRangeException,
                                 EmptyingException,
                                 NotCompatibleException
        Returns the data at input node nodeNumber. If data is not ready, NOT_READY triana type is returned. If there is no cable connected to the input node the NOT_CONNECTED triana type is returned.
        Specified by:
        getInput in interface RunnableInterface
        Parameters:
        nodeNumber - the node you want to get the data from.
        Returns:
        the data input at node nodeNumber
        Throws:
        OutOfRangeException
        EmptyingException
        NotCompatibleException

      • getInput

        protected java.lang.Object getInput(RunnableNodeInterface node)
        Returns the data at the specified input node. If data is not ready, NOT_READY triana type is returned. If there is no cable connected to the input node the NOT_CONNECTED triana type is returned.

      • output

        public void output(java.lang.Object data)
        b Outputs the data from the unit. This passses the given data set to the first output node and then makes copies for any other output nodes.
        Specified by:
        output in interface RunnableInterface
        Parameters:
        data - the data to be sent

      • output

        public void output(int outputNode,
          java.lang.Object data,
          boolean blocking)
        Outputs the data to the given node outputNode. If specified this method blocks until the data is successfully sent, otherwise, if non-blocking, isOutputSent() can be used to poll whether the data has been successfully sent. This method is used to set the data at each particular output node if this is necessary, otherwise use output(Object data) to copy the data across all nodes.
        Specified by:
        output in interface RunnableInterface
        Parameters:
        outputNode - the output node you wish to set
        data - the data to be sent

      • isOutputSent

        public boolean isOutputSent(int outputNode)
        Specified by:
        isOutputSent in interface RunnableInterface
        Returns:
        true if the data sent with the non-blocking send call has reached its destination

      • run

        public void run()
        This over-rides the RunnableUnit's run method so that we can display the data flow indicators on the icons when we are processing data.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • runTask

        public void runTask(Task task)
             throws SchedulerException
        Runs the specified task.

        If execution is paused then this method waits until execution is resumed, or throws a SchedulerException if execution is reset.

        Specified by:
        runTask in interface ControlInterface
        Throws:
        SchedulerException

      • runGroup

        public void runGroup()
              throws SchedulerException
        Runs all the tasks within the group that this task belongs to.

        If execution is paused then this method waits until execution is resumed, or throws a SchedulerException if execution is reset.

        Specified by:
        runGroup in interface ControlInterface
        Throws:
        SchedulerException
